direction.raw_text: It is very early in the dawn - blue light filters through the jungle and across a foul swamp. A mist clings to the trees. This could be the jungle of a million years ago. Our VIEW MOVES CLOSER, through the mist, TILTING DOWN to the tepid water. A small bubble rises to the surface; then another. Suddenly, but quietly, a form begins to emerge; a helmet. Water and mud pour off revealing a set of beady eyes just above the mud. Printed on a helmet, in a psychedelic  hand, are the words: "Gook Killer." The head emerges revealing that the tough-looking soldier beneath has  exceptionally long hair and beard; he has no shirt on, only bandoliers of ammunition - his body is painted in an odd camouflage pattern. He looks to the right; he looks to the left; he looks INTO CAMERA, and slowly sinks back into the swamp, disapperaring completely. Our VIEW HOLDS, We begin to HEAR natural, though unrecognizable JUNGLE SOUNDS, far off in the distance. We PAN TO REVEAL a clump of logs half submerged in the swamp; and part of what seems to be a Falstaff beer can in the mud. A hand reaches out, and the beer can disappears. As we TILT UP, we NOTICE that the log is hollow and houses the rear of a M-60 machine gun, hand painted in a paisley design. Now the VIEW MOVES AWAY, ACROSS the ancient growth, PAST the glimmer of what seems to be another soldier hiding in ambush, wearing an exotic hat made from birds and bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to a dark trail where the legs of those in black pajamas move silently across our ever TIGHTENING VIEW. Their feet, boots and sandals leave no impression; make no sound. A slight flicker of light reveals a pair of eyes in the foliage across the path, waiting and watching. The VIEW PUSHES ALONG WITH the Vietnamese, MOVING FASTER
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: them, until suddenly, directly in front about ten feet away, an enormous AMERICAN clad in rags and bushes and holding a 12 gauge automatic shotgun casually at his side, steps in front of them. He smiles laconically, and BLASTS OUT FIVE SHOTS that rip THROUGH US. By the second shot, the whole jungle blazes out with AUTOMATIC FIRE. Out VIEW TURNS as the men around us are thrown and torn, screaming and scattering into the jungle. More AMERICANS appear; unexplainably, out of the growth. It is now that we fully SEE the bizarre manner in which they are dressed. Some wear helmets, others wear strange hats made from feathers and parts of animals. Some of them have long savage-looking hair; other crew-cut or completely shaved; they wear bandoliers, flak jackets, shorts and little else. They wear Montagnard sandals or no shoes at all, and their bodies and faces are painted in bizarre camouflage patterns. They appear one with the jungle and mist, FIRING INTO US as they move. The soldier we saw earlier emerges from the swamp, dripping mud, his MACHINE GUN BLASTING FIRE. We begin to move quickly with one Vietnamese, breathlessly running for his life; we MOVE INTO the jungle with him, only to be impaled on a large spear of a smiling AMERICAN painted and wearing feathers like an Indian. OUR VIEW FALLS WITH him to the ground, STARING UPWARDS, as FLAME and EXPLODING MUD scatter above us. Men scream and die around us. The screams amid the GUNFIRE and EXPLOSIONS are piercing and terrible, as though the jungle itself is frightened. An AMERICAN wearing a jungle hat with a large Peace Sign on it, wearing war paint, bends TOWARD US, reaching down
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with a large knife, preparing to scalp the dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: along with the running sandals of a Vietnamese soldier, MOVING FASTER AND FASTER, only to be stopped by still another of the savage-looking AMERICANS with primitive ornamentation, wearing only a loin-cloth and green beret. He opens his flame-thrower directly ON US and the NVA soldier and we are incinerated in flame, bright psychedelic orange-red flame. Outrageous, loud, electric ROCK MUSIC OVERWHELMS the SOUNDTRACK : MAIN TITLE : APOCALYPSE NOW 2  TITLE SEQUENCE The CREDIT TITLES proceed as the FLANE CONSUME US, growing more intense, brighter, more vivid, purifying; transforming into an intense white heat that we can barely look at, like the sun itself. Then it EXPLODES, breking apart, and shattering once again. It begins to cool, as the TITLES CONTINUE. It is as though WE ARE MOVING through the white center of cooling flame, forming a spinning web, and becoming more distant. The TITLES CONTINUE. We are MOVING TOWARD planetary nebulae; MOVING through the stars; MOVING closer to the Earth. We can BARELY HEAR the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now. We MOVE CLOSER to the earth; beautiful, covered in clouds, as though SEEN from a satellite. The TITLES CONTINUE. We are MOVING CLOSER to the earth; through the soft clouds, close enough that we can MAKE OUT the Western Hemisphere;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R to North America; CLOSER, to America, then California; Los Angeles, STILL CLOSER to the odd, finger-like shapes of :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARINA DEL REY The VIEW finally SETTLES ON a partically luxury cabin cruiser harbored at a particular dock late in the day. It is large, pleasure boat: The people are relaxing in bathing suits and towels and robes. They are drinking cocktails, and snapping pictures. The boat belongs to the head of a large American Corporation, and this is his party. This man, CHARLIE, is sitting, his shirt off to catch some of the late sun. Others have their faces smeared with white suntan oil that reminds us of war paint. Charlie is going on and on :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It's crazy -- sugar is up to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dollars a ton -- sugar !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about oil ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food, oil --look, let me show you something. This is the economy of the United States in two years -- He takes a newspaper, draws a circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is West Germany. (he draws another, bigger circle) This is Japan. (another , bigger) This is Italy. (a dot) This is Iran. (a very big circle) And this is Saudi Arabia... In two years ? (a gigantic circle) Do you understand ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's to prevent it ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe nothing. But I'll tell you, I didn't build a two-billion-dollar company in the last twenty years by doing nothing. We can protect our interests. (pause, for a drink) We are still the most powerful nation in the world. Militarily. He leans to his associates, in a half-whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know bodyguard; he was a captain in Viet Nam. You talk to him, except he won't talk. This kind of man can kill you with his pinky. A nice quiet fella, though. The VIEW BEGINS TO PULL AWAY from this group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carries a attache case at all times. You know what's in it ? (another sip) An Ingram Machine pistol. Gradually, Charlie's voice softens as we MOVE AWAY, and a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the voice of someone thinking, COMES IN OVER it :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't tahe chances, and                        Bullshit. You can kill neither should this country.                        with the ridge of your If we're strong, we should                        hand to the throat; you protect our interests, and                        can crush a skull with we should have the respect                        your knee... but you of the world, even if it                                can't kill anybody with takes another war.                                your pinky. The VIEW MOVE ALONG the guests of this small party : Pictures being taken, some people are swimming. It is the good life. Now WILLARD'S VOICE TRACK DOMINATES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The attache case has been empty for three years, but it makes him safe to think there's a machine pistol in it. I don't like automatic weapons. They jam. I saw a friend of mine get ripped open because he flicked his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to automatic, and it jammed. How much money did the contractors make on the M-16 ? Our VIEW IS MOVING through the people on the boat; some reading, flirting, drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He likes to hear stories about Nam. I tell him I can't; they're not cleared. The truth is he wouldn't understand. We can now SEE A MAN with his BACK TO US, looking the opposite way. An attache case resting near to him. We MOVE CLOSER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way I can tell them... what really happened over there. I wouldn't've believed it if someone'd told me. We are now RESTING on his back. Occasionally, he sips from a beer, but we cannot see his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was only one part that mattered -- for me, anyway. I don't even know if I remember all of it. I can't remember how it ended, exactly -- because when it ended I was insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A STREET IN SAIGON - DAY A Saigon boom street in late 1968. There are bars and shops for servicemen; the rickshaws, the motorbikes. Our VIEW MOVES TOWARD one particular officer; B.L.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , in uniform, a Captain of the Airborne, followed by four or five Vietnamese kids trying to shine his shoes and sell him things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I know how it started for me -- I was on R. and R. in Saigon; my first time south of the DMZ in three months. I wasn't sure, but I thought this guy was following me. Willard looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an American CIVILIAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW Willard ducks into a bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE SAIGON BAR - DAY Not much in this place -- a bar, linoleum flooring, a few tables and chairs, and a juke box. The lounge is fairly crowded. Willard takes off his cap and walks quietly past the soldiers at the bar. Some of them, catching sight of his ribbons, stop talking as he moves by. An INFANTRY CAPTAIN enters the bar, buys a couple of drinks and approaches Willard's table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about a drink ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, thanks. He sits down at the table with the drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winning the war by yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which part is that ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My part. (TO THE WAITER) Beer, with ice and water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good gin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure it is, but I had hepatitis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delta ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Way north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What unit were you with ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rangers, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of. The JUKE BOX starts BLARING. Annoyed , Willard looks over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you Longe Range Recon -- WILLARD No -- I worked too far north for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He reaches into his shirt pocket for a cigarette, and the Captain leans over the table to light it for him. Willard notices the CIVILIAN on the street has glanced in the bar, then enters and sits down at a table by the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's quite an array of ribbons...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's talk about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was an FO for the 25th.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracks ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fat. That's real fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least you always have enough water. How many gallons does each one of those damn things carry ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty -- sometimes fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I can remember once, getting back below the DMZ -- and the first Americans we ran into were a track squadron. I just couldn't believe how much water they had. We'd been chewing bamboo shoots for almost a week, and before that, for two weeks, we'd been drinking anything -- rain water, river shit, stuff right out of the paddies. And there were these guys standing by their trucks spilling water all over. I could've killed them. (solemnly) I swear to God I would have, too, if ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know we had units up there in North Vietnam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long were you up there ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A year ? Waiter another beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I go up on missions. Listen Captain, buy me all the beer you want, but you better tell that asshole over there you're not going to find out anymore about me. Willard glances over his shoulder and indicates the Civilian. The Civilian is given a sign by the Captain. He rises and comes over to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're B.L. Willard, 4th Recon Group, we'd like you to come with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose orders ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Headquarters 11 Corps -- 405th A.S.A Battalion -- S-2 -- Com-Sec -- Intelligence -- Nha Trang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The agency. Willard looks at the Civilian a moment, and then walks roght out toward the jeep without saying another word. The Civilian follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HELICOPTER - DUSK A darkly painted "HUEY" ROARS over low paddies and jungle before emerging onto an open plain. It crosses a barbed wire and sand-bagged perimeter and lands in a heavily fortified, concealed compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They took me to some place outside Nha Trang... Intelligence Headquarters for all operations in South East Asia. I'd worked for Intelligence before -- Armed men jump from the Huey -- among them Willard. A large camouflaged cover is moved, revealing an underground corridor -- they enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door swings wide -- Willard steps through and comes to attention, blocking the view of the room. A strange reddish light pervades. The room is covered with plastic maps and filled with smoke. The whole place has been hewn out of the ground itself and there is a sense of the cut-back jungle growth slowly reclaiming it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain B.L. Willard, G-4 Headquarters, reporting as ordered, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Willard, sit down. Willard sits in a chair that is set in a center of a bare concrete floor. Across from him, around steel desks and tables sit several men. The nearest one, a COLONEL puts his cigar out on the bottom of his shoe -- behind him sits a MAJOR and a seedy-looking CIVILIAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever seen this officer before, Captain Willard ? He points to the Major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This gentleman or myself ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe on your last job you executed a tax collector in Kontum, is that right ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not presently disposed to discuss that, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. He turns to the Colonel and nods his approval. The Colonel gets up and goes to a large plastic map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know much about about Special Forces; Green Berets, Captain ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've worked with them on occasions and I saw the movie , sir. The officer smiles at this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you can appreciate Command's concern over their -- shall we say 'erratic' methods of operation. (pause) I have never favored elite units, Captain, including your paratroopers or whatever. Just because a man jumps out of an airplane or wears a silly hat doesn't give him any priviliges in my book -- not in this man's army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't need 'em in Korea -- no sir, give me an Ohio farm boy and an M-1 Garand, none of this fancy crap -- no sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have Special Forces A detachments all along the Cambodian border. Two here and another one here -- twelve or fourteen Americans -- pretty much on their own; they train and motivate Montagnard natives; pick their own operations. If they need something, they call for it, and get it within reason. What we're concerned with is here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW - ON THE MAP COLONEL The A detachment at Nu Mung Ba. It was originally a larger base, built up along the river in an old Cambodian fortress. The area has been relatively quiet for the past two years -- but -- 11  MED VIEW COLONEL ... Captain, we know something's going on up there -- Major -- The Major looks at some papers in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Communications naturally dwindled with the lack of V.C. activity, this is routine, expected ... but six months ago communication virtually stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About the same time -- large numbers of Montagnards of the M'Nong descent began leaving the area -- this in itself is not unusual since these people have fought with the Rhade Tribe that lived in the area for centuries. But what is unusual is that we began to find Rhade refugees too -- in the same sampans as the M'Nongs. These people aren't afraid of V.C. They've put up with war for twenty years -- but something is driving them out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We communicate with the base infrequently. What they call for are air strikes, immediate -- always at night. And we don't know what or who the air strikes are called on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, no one has really gone into this area and come back alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why me ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter Kurtz, Lieutenant Colonel, Special Forces. We understand you knew him. He puts Kurtz' dossier in Willard's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's commanding the detachment at Nu Mung Ba. The Colonel gets up and walks over to a tape recorder, flicks it on. The recording is first STATIC -- the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then asks for more information on target coordinates -- it all sounds very routine, military. Then a frantic VOICE comes on, talking slurred, like someone dumb, except very fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up 2 -- 0 -- give it to me quick -- Mark flare -- affirmative damn -- Immediate receive -- hearing automatic weapons fire man ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is HEARD and a lower, slower VOICE in background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blue Delta five This Big Rhine -- three Need that ordinance immediately Goddamn give it to me immediate Christ -- Big Rhino -- Blue God -- Delta damn -- goddamn. A heavy BURST of AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE -- INSANE LAUGHTER -- STATIC, and faintly, very faintly we HEAR HARD ROCK MUSIC -- more STATIC -- suddenly a low, clear VOICE peaceful and serene, almost tasting the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Big Rhino six -- Blue Delta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Colonel Kurtz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want that napalm dropped in the trees -- spread it among the branches. We'll give you a flare -- an orange one -- bright orange. (STATIC) We'd also like some white phosporous, Blue Delta. White phosporous, give it to me.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE -- INSANE LAUGHTER -- STATIC,

direction.raw_text: interrupts -- the Major turns the machine off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only met Kurtz once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would he remember you ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was your impression of him ? Willard shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone got a cigarette. The Major offers him one; they wait as he lights up, thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was a lame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lame ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is years ago, before he joined Special Forces, I guess. We had an argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He was a lame, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't get through a sentence without all these big words; about why we kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's killing now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's not Kurtz. I don't believe he's capable of that. I just don't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's got to be Kurtz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The point is that Kurtz or somebody attacked a South Vietnamese Ranger Platoon three days ago. Last week a Recon helicopter was lost in the area -- another took heavy damage -- direct fire from their base camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our Recon flight ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can see, of course, the implications, if any of this -- even rumours leaked out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to clean it up -- simple and quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly -- you'll go up the Nung River in a Navy P.B.R. -- appear at Nu Mung Ba as if by accident, re-establish your acquintance with Colonel Kurtz, find out what's happened -- and why. Then terminate his command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terminate ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terminate with extreme prejudice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ON THE DELTA A waterway leading out to the ocean -- it is broken and divided into hundreds of channels, islands, water farms. A Navy patrol boat (P.B.R.) is waiting by a dock area. This is small, light craft, very fast, and heavily armed. Its men stand at attention in a small and simple military ceremony. Willard approaches them in battle- dress: Tiger suit, full field pack, forty-five, helmet,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The boat commander salutes Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW We hear the introductions faintly, UNDER Willard's VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met the P.B.R. crew; they were pretty much all kids, except for Phillips, the Chief -- Gunner's Mate Third Class L. Johnson -- Lance Johnson; Gunner's Mate Third Class J. Hicks -- The Chef -- Radio Operator Second Class T. Miller; they called him Mr. Clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chief, try to keep out of where we're going -- Why we're goin' and what's gonna be the big surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right with me, I used to drive a taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. The Chief nods.  They all break formation and jump aboard and otherwise go about their work. The twin diesels kick up -- and t he boat moves away from the dock. The Chef jumps aboard; Lance mans the forward twin fifty-caliber machine guns -- they wave to the guards on the dock and move away into the complexity that leads to the ocean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - STORMY SEA The boat slams through the heavy sea ; hurtling off the top of a wave and crashing full into the trough of another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD AND CHIEF Willard holds on to whatever he can -- he looks very pale. Water crashes over the bow and drenches everyone. The Chief mans the wheel and the ENGINES WHINE. Lance climbs back from his position. He looks at Willard, who just stares ahead into space, swallowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dusk is spectacular through the broken storm clouds -- the sea is calm again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - PROCEEDING UP THE COAST The Chief is at the helm -- Willard approaches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Delta closes off to us about ten  miles out of Hau Fat. We'll be able to pick up some supplies -- bit I think there are only two points we can draw enough water to get into the Nung River. It's all Charlie's turf from there on out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna have some help to get in the river. You know these waters, Chief ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout six months ago I took a man up to Lo Mung Bridge. He was regular Army too. Shot himself in the head. I brought his body back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shot himself. What for ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beats me -- the sun was too much for him, or the mud. Who knows ? Pause, looking at Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, his attention is diverted -- there is a slow buffeting, as if the air around them is being sucked out and replaced quickly. The boat shakes slightly. There is a distant ROLLING NOISE like interrupted thunder. All the men have stopped whatever they're doing -- stand up and look out toward the shore and the green jungle hills beyond. The buffeting and NOISE CONTINUES -- they all stand silently -- suddenly it stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate that -- Every time I hear that noise something terrible happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody see some smoke ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too far inland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There they are. He points up to the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Way up -- past any clouds and barely discernible, we SEE the black silhouttes of four B-52 bombers, their vapor trails streaming white against the dark blue sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie don't ever hear 'em. Not till it's too late -- don't have to hit you neither, concussion'll do it for a quarter mile or better. Burst your ears -- suck the air outta your lungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CREW They are looking up. Willard sits down, unconcerned. He takes out the dossier given him by ComSec. He flips through the letters and other documents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dossier on A detachment had letters from Kurtz' wife and the wives and families of his men. All asking where to send future mail, understanding the necessery silence due to the nature of their work -- None of the men had written home in half a year. Occasionally, in the b.g., we FEEL the terrifying buffeting of the distant B-52 BOMBING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: studying, examining a report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kurtz' face evolves through the various stages of his career as represented in the pictures in the dossier, as Willard reads :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant Kurtz has shown a dedicated and well-disciplined spirit. He is a fine officer, combining military efficiency -- with a broad background in the Humanities, the Arts and Sciences ... Another picture of Kurtz in Germany, standing next to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: st Petroleum Supply Group sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He views his military career as the dedication of his talents to bringing our values and way of life to those darker, less fortunate areas in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Kurtz at jump school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I feel Captain Kurtz' request for Special Forces training is highly unusual in regard to his past humanitarian concerns, and his somewhat liberal politics, though I can see no reason to deny it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Kurtz with Green Beret on in the Vietnam jungle. His face is blank and vacant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... We feel Major Kurtz' need to bring a sense of Western culture to the backward peoples of these areas will be of use in accordance with our 'Vietnamization' programs ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kurtz' empty eyes until the photograph is just a BLURRED MASS OF DOTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAU FAT - AN ADVANCE STAGING AREA WILLARD (V.O.) One day later we came to an advanced staging area along the coast. This was our last chance to pick up supplies before approaching the mouth of the Nung River. The VIEW OF THE COASTLINE leading up along the long load- ing docks at Hau Fat, an advance staging area for opera- tions "Brute Force" and "Mailed Fist." Everywhere are tents -- oil drums -- sandbagged bunkers -- helicopters -- tanks -- guns -- men. Nobody builds advanced staging areas like the Americans. As the P.B.R. approaches the docking area, Lance notices something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. They look as a Chris-craft speeds by pulling a fancy water- skier who waves as he slaloms by. The men just look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The P.B.R. pulls in -- the men scan the busy surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance -- I want you to go with the Captain an' get three extra drums of fuel and maybe scrounge some more 50 caliber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- look at those uniforms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TROOPS A platoon drills in the hot, lazy sun; they are clean and pale, in contrast to Lance and the others, just off the airplane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor bastards, have a long year to go. The troops turn and march TOWARD US with six weeks of Advanced Infantry Training to back them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - P.B.R. - CREW They are tying up at the dock -- a young SERGEANT is fill- ing cut papers concerning them and talking with Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything about these papers, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're in order -- it's perfectly clean -- just check with ComSec- Intel like I said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know I don't have the priority to do that, sir. It says here not to contact Com-Sec- Int. Who's your commanding officer ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now -- I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well who the hell verifies that ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. He signs it quickly, leaving the Sergeant totally confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shit -- what's all the activity for around here ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The show -- WILLARD What show ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big show in the parade grounds this noon -- some boss stuff -- WILLARD This -- Bob Hope or the like -- SERGEANT No sir, I think -- this'll be a little bit different -- CHIEF Where's it gonna be ? He points -- 27  FULL SHOT - PARADE GROUNDS - PEDESTAL A large, well-built pedestal has been erected -- this is surrounded by a deep moat filled with punji stakes and garnished with concertina wire. It is empty -- DISSOLVE TO :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TROOPS The entire area around the pedestal and right up to the wire is mobbed with seething American fighting men. Some of these boys have just gotten here -- others have been in the jungle for months. All have one thing in common, to see and if possible grab an American girl. Their need far surpasses that of the run-of-the-mill rapist, pervert, or child-molester. To counter their need of course are the moat, punji stakes and barbed wire -- but implementing this are seven "riot control positions" equipped with the lastest in teargas launchers, attack-trained German shep- herds and assorted psychological warfare aides. Even so armed, the great mass of wild men are right up to the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jammed in the crowd
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really too much -- I mean I've collected every picture of her since she was Miss December.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- you can really get hung up on them like the cat in the Delta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What cat  ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One that went up for murder -- he was an Army Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never heard about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- he really dug his Playboy mag, man -- I mean like he was there when it arrived -- He just knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what happened ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was working A.R.V.N. patrols and had one a them little cocky gook asshole Lieutenants -- anyhow, the Lieutenant took his new Playboy one day, sat on the end of the dock, and wouldn't give it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- typical A.R.V.N.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then went too far -- he sat there and starts mutilating the centerfold. Poking pins in her an' all that. Sergeant says, don't do her like that. You leave your shitty little hands off that girl. Gook Lieutenant says Fuck you in Vietnamese -- Sergeant says, don't do that again. You'll wish you hadn't. Then he stood up, flicked his iron to rock and roll and gave the little zero a long burst through the Playboy mag. Man, it blew him clean off the dock -- Hell, just the magazine was floatin' there all full of holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They nail him for it bad ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in the L.B.J. -- didn't give him no medals or nothing -- In the b.g., we begin to HEAR a SWELL of TWO THOUSAND MALE VOICES; the ENGINES of four helicopters approaching. All heads turn skywards while one descends onto the pedestal kicking up a lot of dust and general resentment. On the nose amd doors of the black Huey are painted large Playboy rabbits. Finally the blades are trimmed and a strange silence descends over the men. The door of the copter slides partially open -- two young Green Berets step out with M-16's to varied catcalls. When this abates a young, extremelly well-dressed man emerges. He is the epitome of a Hollywood AGENT. Hair is combed impeccably and free of dandruff -- clothes are formal but hip -- shoes are shined -- Quite some dude -- his presence causes some stirring but seems to strangely quiet the man. He walks over to the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to say hello from all of us up here, to all of you out there. All of you who've worked so hard during Operation Brute Force -- Paratroopers -- Infantry -- Airmen
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medics -- Marines -- and Sailors. And I want you to know that we feel proud of you and know how hard your job is. To prove it -- we've brought some entertainment we think you're gonna like: The Playmate of the Year and her two runners up ! He pulls open the door and three unbelieveably beautiful sex playmates in fringed go-go outfits leap out and start dancing to the Creedence Clearwater Revival singing "Suzy Q."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the girls dance in an incredibly erotic manner -- smiling. The faces of the G.I.'s pass -- their jaws drop -- some look almost horrified. Chef is hypnotized -- Mr. Clean cries. Chief mouths unspoken obscenities with sentimental tenderness. Others grab the air in front of them. With each movement their need increases by the square.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GIRLS - MEN They crush forward starting to scream -- men fall on the wire -- the guards in the "riot control positions" forget
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the attack dogs are trampled. The mob as one surges forward onto the wire. Men scream and fall into the moat, which is filling up fast. The Agent sees this all as he has seen it before. He casually pulls the pin of a smoke grenade; the girls retreat into the copter -- he follows, then the two Green Berets. The ROTARS WHINE -- the black Playboy Huey lifts off just as the first crazed men reach it. They grab frantically for the wheels, but miss. The Huey wheels up into the blue sky, leaving them all below. Such are the ways of war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FULL VIEW - DAY The P.B.R. moving further up the primitive coastline. There are few signs of civilization; no villages, no boats -- just the overwhelming presence of the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two days out of Hau Fat, there was nothing but us and the coastline. I felt like I had set off for the center of the earth... Suddenly, Chief looks out, ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where ? They all turn. Chief points up the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thick train of black smoke rises from the green jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black smoke ... secondary burning. The Chief grabs field glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- fishing village -- helicopters over there. Hueys, lots of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First Air Cavalry. They're the ones gonna get us into the River.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vast field of devastation -- smashed and smoking palm trees -- deep, ragged craters -- gutted and burning huts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shattered sampans and bodies washing around in the surf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD AND CREW They wade through the water to the beach where they are met by a heavily armed group of men. Overhead jets swoop by FIRING ROCKETS, the NOISE drowning out Willard's attempt at conversation with some of the men. We can't hear any of the talk, but we notice that the Sergeant turns up to a particular Huey, and points to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three Hueys swoop in low -- they are heavily laden with machine guns -- rockets and loudspeakers. The two out- side copters hover, while the center copter lands, raising a lot of dust. It cuts its rotors and the other copters pull up and off to the side. Two armed soldiers jump from the doors and stand with guns ready. Then a tall, strong looking man emerges. He wears a well-cut and neatly-stretched tiger suit. It is COLONEL WILLIAM KILGORE -- tough looking, well-tanned, with a black mustache. He crouches over, holding his hat in the rotor wash. It is no ordinary hat but a L.A. Dodgers baseball hat. He walks out, and then stards to his full immense height and with his hands on his hips he surveys the field of battle. His eyes are obscured by mirror-fronted sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant: Bomb that tree line back about a hundred yards -- give me some room to breathe. A Lieutenant and radio man nod and rush off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW ON WILLARD He was not quite prepared for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turning to his GUARDS KILGORE Bring me some cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Body cards, you damn fool -- cards ! The soldier rushes over and hands him two brand new packages of playing cards wrapped in plastic. Two other soldiers get out of the copter and walk over. They are well-tanned and carry no weapons. They seem more casual about the Colonel than anyone else. The Sergeant walks up, leading Willard, the Chief and Lance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain B-L. Willard, sir -- 4th Recon Group -- I carry priority papers from Com-Sec Intelligence
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corp -- I believe you understand the nature of my mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- Na Trang told me to expect you -- we'll see what we can do. Just stay out of my way till this is done, Captain. He cracks the plastic wrapping sharply -- takes out the deck of new cards and fans them. The Colonel strides right past Willard with no further acknowledgement. The others follow,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW The Colonel walks through the shell-pocked field of devastation. Soldiers gather around smiling; as Kilgore comes to each V.C. corpse he drops a playing card on it -- carefully picking out which card he uses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six a spades -- eight a hearts -- Isn't one worth a Jack in this whole place. The Colonel goes on about this business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moving through the corpses, dropping the cards. On of the two tanned soldiers rushes up and whispers something to him. He stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ? Here. You sure? The soldier points to Lance, who immediately puts down the card he was holding. Kilgore strides over to the young man, who almost instinctively moves closer t Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name, sailor ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gunner's Mate, Third Class -- L. Johnson, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance Johnson? The surfer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, sir. Kilgore smiles -- sticks out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an honor to meet you Lance. I've admired your nose-riding for years -- I like your cutback, too. I think you have the best cutback there is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can cut out the sir, Lance -- I'm Bill kilgore -- I'm a goofy foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His entire, top priority  mission has been put in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Mike from San Diego and Johnny from Malibu -- they're good solid surfers -- none of us are anywhere near your class, though. Lance blushes, sort of mumbling thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My orders are from Com-Sec Intel -- B.L. Willard, 4th Recon -- KILGORE Just hold up a second, Captain -- I'll get to you soon enough -- We've got things to do here. Willard eats it, for now. Kilgore puts his hand on Lance's shoulder, and continues flipping the cards in- discriminately on the bodies as they talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... we do a lot of surfing around here. Like to finish up operations early and fly down to Vung Tau for the evening glass. Have you ever surfed the point at Vung Tau? I liked the beach breaks around Na Trang a lot -- good lefts. He passes a twisted gun emplacement with about five bodies -- sprinkles cards all over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... we keep three boards in my Command Huey at all times. You never can tell when you're gonna run into something good. I got a guy in Cam Rau Bay that can predict a swell two days in advance. We try to work it in. He stops at a particularly wild-looking Viet Cong who has died with his mouth agape -- staring wild-eyed in horror at the sky. Kilgore pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, that's an Ace if I ever saw one. He puts the card in the gaping mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW OVER THE VIET CONG We SEE the Colonel and the others walk off -- the dead Viet Cong and card are in the immediate f.g. The card has the shield of the CAV printed bautifully, and above it the motto: DEATH FROM ABOVE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where've you been riding, Lance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't surfed since I got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's terrible -- we'll change that -- I'd like to see you work -- I've always liked your cutback; got a hell of a left turn, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HELICOPTER - MED. SHOT Willard is sitting with Kilgore on acouple of chairs by a table set up in front of the command copter. Everywhere we SEE armed men, sandbags, barbed wire, oil drums etc. Hueys are constantly ROARING over. ARTILLERY BOOMS in the far distance. Kilgore looks at the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the hell you wanna go up to Nu Mung Ba for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got bored in Saigon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the furthest you been in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haiphong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haiphong? Shit, you jump in ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Walked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you do for supplies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercenaries -- agents, traitors -- they put out caches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you trust them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. They put out two or three for every one I needed. When you get to the one you'll use, you just stake it out. If something feels wrong, you just pass it up. On one mission, I had to pass up three and ended up living on rats and chocolate bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nu Mung Ba. Last I heard, Walter Kurtz commanded a Green Beret detachment at Nu Mung Ba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout a year ago? Is Kurtz still alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems to me he got himself fragged. i heard some grunt rolled a grenade in his tent. Maybe a rumor. Helluva man -- remarkable officer. Walter Kurtz woulda been a General some day. General of the Army. Shit, Head of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Did you knew Kurtz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you agree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He musta changed ! (pointing to the map) I got to get into the Nung River, here or here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That village you're pointing at is kinda hairy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hairy ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean it's hairy -- they got some pretty heavy ordnance, boy -- I've lost a few recon ships in there now and again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? I heard you had a good bunch of killers here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't intend to get some of them chewed up just to get your tub put in the mouth of the goddman Nung River. You say you don't know Kurtz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talk like him. I don't mind taking casualties, Captain, but I like to keep my ratio ten to one in this unit -- ten Cong to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll find enough Cong up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about this point here? He puts his finger on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the name of that goddamn village -- Vin Drin Dop or Lop; damn gook names all sound the same. He motions to one of his surfers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, you know anything about the point at Vin Drip Drop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really long left slide, breaks on the short side of the point -- catches a south swell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice. Willard looks at Lance -- then at Kilgore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the hell didn't you tell me about that place -- a good left. (to Willard) There aren't any good left slides in this whole, shitty country. It's all goddamn beach break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hairy ,though. That's where we lost McDonnel -- they shot the hell out of us. It's Charlie's point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How big it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six to eight feet. Kilgore gazes out across the parked helicopters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A six-foot left. Willard nudges Lance -- who gets the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss. What's the wind like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Light off shore -- really hollow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could go in tomorrow at dawn
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: there's always off-shore wind in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The draft of that river might be too shallow on the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, we'll pick your boat up and lay it down like a baby, right where you want it. This is the Cav boy -- airmobile. I can take that point and hold it as long as I like -- and you can get anywhere you want up that river that suits you, Captain. Hell, a six foot left. (he turns to an advisor) You take a gunship back to division
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, take Lance with you -- let him pick out a board, and bring me my Yater Spoon -- the eight six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, sir -- it's -- it's -- KILGORE (hard) What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I mean it's hairy in there
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's Charlie's point. Kilgore turns and looks to Willard, exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie don't surf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What seems like hundreds of Hueys standing, their rotors churning a great wind -- Inside, the men of the 1st Cavalry Airmobile -- toughest unit in Vietnam. Kilgore's helicopter is being loaded with ammunition and has surfboards strapped underneath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW Kilgore strides up to the side door, dressed for battle. He looks out, around. He turns to his door GUNNER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you feel, boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a mean motherfucker, sir. He turns to his R.T. man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helicopter rotors build up speed -- gas turbines belching fire from their jet pipes -- dust flying as fifty helicopters rise; ROAR OVER CAMERA and deploy into attack formation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helicopters moving THROUGH the FRAME: almost a dance of dragonflies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - MED. SHOT - KILGORE, WILLARD, OTHERS Willard looks ahead -- Kilgore sits near the door. Below they see the jungle whisk by and they are suddenly over the ocean, low and fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSE SHOTS of rocket pods -- mini-guns in bizarre looking mounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S of the three surfboards strapped below the command helicopter, next to the fearsome weaponry. And finally, CLOSE SHOTS of the men -- nervous, excited very few of them really scared -- they fondle their rifles, grenade launchers, anti-personnel grenades, claymore mines; plastic explosives cord; flame-throwers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: machine guns; expandable rocket launchers; mortars and bayonets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER Kilgore cranes his neck and almost leans out to watch the waves -- then he sits back relaxed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll come in low out of the rising sun -- We'll put on the music about a mile out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Classical stuff -- scares the hell out of the slopes -- the boys love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: POV behind the PILOT and CO-PILOT -- the ocean rushes below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Duke six to Eagle Thrust -- turn on coordinates 1-0 -- niner, assume attack formation. The helicopter banks into a tight turn and bears toward the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eagle Thrust formation target
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: yards -- begin psch-war operations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ocean rushes below as suddenly the LOUDSPEAKERS BLARE out Wagner's "Ride of the Valkyries."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the water we SEE the massive grouping of Hueys -- gun- ships -- troop carriers -- medevac and recon -- ROAR over low in battle formation BLARING out "Ride of the Valkyries."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HELICOPTER - MED. SHOT -CREW
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind pilot -- PILOT 700 -- 600 yards -- 500 -- Commence firing. The whole copter shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIET CONG FISHING VILLAGE - FULL SHOT A Vietnamese coastal fishing village built along the beach and palm trees -- with rice paddies behind. This village commands a delta where ocean and river merge. Sampans are pulled into a cover where they are being unloaded. We SEE bunkers with N.V.A. regulars ambling about. Suddenly we HEAR the distant MUSIC -- Everyone stops; they stare out to see. Men scream orders -- women run from huts bearing ammunition and rifles -- Everywhere there is activity to prepare for the defense of the village. Camouflage is removed from anti-aircraft emplacements. People feverishly unlimber weapons of all types and run to tunnels and trenches. The MUSIC GROWS LOUDER with the FAINT SOUND of ROTORS 56  EXT. THE HELICOPTER FORMATION - AERIAL VIEW coming directly at us; WAGNER BLARING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking down through the helicopters as they approach the village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HELICOPTER - MED. SHOT - CREW POV behind pilot
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: yards -- 600 -- 500 -- commence firing. The whole copter shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HELICOPTERS - MONTAGE We SEE rockets ROAR from pods -- MACHINE GUNS RATTLE -- grenade launchers POUND away -- and MINI-GUNS pour streams of lead and tracers with the SOUND of a DIESEL HORN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind lead gunship. They ROAR in over the beach streaming FIRE from doors, pods and nose -- The ground is alive with smoke and fire -- a hut EXPLODES. The leads ship banks sharply up over the trees -- men run below SHOOTING back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crash around -- the MUSIC and SOUND of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: almost drown them out. The gunner FIRES frantically -- COPTERS are ROARING over -- GUNFIRE rips around. The gunner is blown away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE ON WILLARD as the ship he is in swoops down, its MACHINE GUNS FIRING into the village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pilot leans out and SHOOTS a charging V.C. in the head with his .38, then ducks back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're down, Eagle Thrust -- we're hit. We got a hot L.Z. here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the plexiglass. The Pilot FIRES back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell of a hot L.Z. Need immediate air strike on the tree line, Eagle Thrust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - MED. SHOT - WILLARD, KILGORE, OTHERS Kilgore has R.T. equipment -- he leans out near the door gunner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Duke Six to Hell's Angels Four
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bring it in on along tree line and huts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell's Angels Four to Big Duke Six -- we'll need green smoke -- suggest you have the FAC mark it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't got time, Hell's Angels -- lay it right up the tree line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four F-4H Phantoms peel off and streak toward the coast.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: VIEW ON WILLARD AND KILGORE KILGORE

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - VIEW ON WILLARD AND KILGORE KILGORE Fucking savages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The enemy. Who else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The jets streak by below laying in huge gobs of orange napalm along the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good, Hell's Angels -- suggest you follow with cannon fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - MED. SHOT They circle the battle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Baker Delta Four -- Captain hit bad -- need dust-off. Receiving heavy automatic weapons fire from huts about thirty yards to our left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Duke Six to Baker Delta Four
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hold -- we're right over you. He turns to door gunner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right along the doors, boy. The gunner FIRES leaning out -- KILGORE (continuing) Fine... fine... little higher. Through the roof; yeah, that's good. He leans back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't anybody bring me any bombs, grenades, claymores or anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't tell me to, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shoulda known. Suddenly, BULLETS SMASH through the copter -- Plexiglass
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; the copter vibrates and turns sharply. Kilgore is thrown down where he hangs on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonuvabitch -- anybody hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Automatic weapons flashes along those trees -- probably eleven millimeter guns and AK-47's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trees, eh... He grabs the R.T.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eagle Thrust Four -- Big Duke Six. Join me in sparaying some trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative, Big Duke Six -- We're even got some rockets left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take her in low, Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two helicopters swoop up out of the smoke and blast the trees with ROCKETS, MACHINE GUNS and GRENADE LAUNCHERS. Other copters join -- The V.C. break and run through the rice paddies in the f.g. -- BULLETS EXPLODING around them -- they scream and fall FIRING back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - MED. SHOT - KILGORE, WILLARD Kilgore looks out as three V.C. break and run through the rice paddies -- the helicopter turns and follows them -- the door gunner swings out and BLASTS two of them into the mud. He takes a bead on the third.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it, boy. He puts his arms across the sights -- the gunner swings back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take her up to 300 feet, Lieutenant. They rise above the paddy -- the man below runs for all he's worth. Kilgore motions to the door gunner who steps aside. Kilgore buckles himself into the gunner's harness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rifle. A hand passes him a M-16.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My rifle, soldier. There is some fumbling and then a hand passes him a 300 Weatherby Magnum with a zebra wood stock -- mother of pearl inlays and a variable power scope. Kilgore takes it and opens the bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amazed at these proceedings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he loads the rifle with huge cartridges. He gets into the sling and slams the bolt shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: POV. ON THE V.C. He is running hard, but starting to sink into the mud. The Huey DRONES overhead, its huge shadow behind him on the mud. He turns and FIRES with a pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COPTER - MED. SHOT - KILGORE, WILLARD Kilgore leans out; pulls the gun in tight -- takes careful aim and the Cong is BLASTED flat into the paddy. Kilgore leans back, opens the bolt, ejecting the spent cartridge out the door. He hands Weatherby back into the copter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gaudy rifle passed by him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's 27, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone got a card? Somebody hands Willard the deck. He takes a card and flips it out of the copter, never lifting his gaze from Kilgore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE CAV, V.C. Americans run through the hooches FIRING and throwing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Helicopters swoop overhead -- JETS ROAR by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uniformed N.V.A. regulars burst from a tunnel en- trance and charge the Americans. The SHOOTING is at point blank range -- automatic, as the V.C. are cut down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMAND COPTER - KILGORE, WILLARD, LANCE, ETC. Kilgore leans out carefully, looking over the battle- field. He has the R.T. He leans back, deliberately avoiding Willard to speak to Lance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The L.Z.'s cooling off fast -- we'll move in another company an' then we'll own it. (he laughs to himself) Charlie's point. He looks out toward the ocean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good swell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said it's a good swell -- hell of a good swell 'bout six feet. Let's get a look at it. Lance looks at Willard and then agrees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pilots are used to this -- they bank sharply and swoop in on the lineup of waves, coming in  low over the point and streaking down a long, lined-up green wall as if surfing it. They tip up over and up at the last minute as the wave breaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Americans line up blindfolded Viet Cong and N.V.A. regular troops outside a burning hut. GUNFIRE is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and sporadic -- an occasional MORTAR round
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in. A soldier yells in Vietnamese in a southern accent and the prisoners are marched away. Other soldiers are already setting up heavy weapons emplacements -- 50 cal machine guns etc. Three Hueys ROAR in, fanning the smoke with their wind. The center one, the command ship, lands. JETS SCREAM over and the two gunships pull up at 200 feet. Another Huey zooms in low and lands behind the Colonel's. The doors open, guards jump out, check the situation, and out steps Kilgore and Lance. From the other copter are more guards, Kilgore's surfers and others of the P.B.R. crew. Willard follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stride out across the debris-strewn beach. Kilgore stands majestically on the point watching the waves. A SHELL SCREAMS overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incoming ! They all dive, except Kilgore. He is watching a big set
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the SHELL EXPLODES in the water about a hundred yards away, sending up a huge geyser of spray. Kilgore is unmoved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that. They look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This  L.Z. is still pretty hot, sir, maybe we oughta stand somewhere else. Kilgore pays him no mention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm waiting for the fucking boat, Colonel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll get here, soldier. He turns to Mike and Johnny who have their faces in the sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wh -- what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change -- get out there -- I want'a see if it's ridable -- change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still pretty hairy, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want'a surf, soldier? He nods yes meakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good, boy, because it's either surf or fight. They turn and hurry off -- Kilgore grabs an M-1 from one of the guards. They all think he's going to shoot the surfers or someone. They move back uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna cover for 'em -- that's all. He cocks thye weapon. Lance looks around uneasily. The Colonel walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think that section on the point is ridable, Lance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we ought to wait for the tide to come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: they all hit the dirt except for Kilgore. It EXPLODES throwing sand through the air. Kilgore leans down yelling over the NOISE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't happen for six hours. Lance looks up at him terrified, holding onto his helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tide -- doesn't come in for six hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MIKE AND JOHNNY They walk through shallows carrying brightly colored boards. They look very scared. JETS SCREAM overhead, FIRING CANNONS. Helicopters wheel by carrying out wounded. They wear olive drab surfing trunks with the Cav's shield on the left leg. The same shield is emblazoned on the boards along the word "Airmobile". They edge into the water and paddle through the mild shorebreak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SURFERS They paddle up the point in the calm channel -- the beautiful waves breaking beyond them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They paddle on their stomachs, keeping low -- breathing hard and constantly looking around scared out of their minds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kilgore looks at them with his field glasses. Lance kind of sits below taking cover in a shell hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They far enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure -- fine -- Kilgore turns and takes a giant electric megaphone from a waiting lackey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's far enough -- pick one up and come on in -- 85  FULL SHOT - THE POINT, SURFERS They line themselves up on the point. A good set is building. Mike turns strokes into it -- takes off
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops to the bottom and turns -- trims up into a tight section -- everything right except he keeps looking around frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another SHELL SCREAMS over and EXPLODES down the beach. Lance looks over at Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he'll get tubed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he'll get inside the tube -- where -- where they can't see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of SHELLS ROAR in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incoming ! Lance ducks -- puts his hands over his head. The SHELLS SCREAM over Kilgore and out towards the point. Kilgore looks through his glasses -- two EXPLOSIONS in the water are HEARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch. Lance looks up and out toward the point in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two surfboards float in the channel bobbing up and down on the waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) The tragedy of this war is a dead surfer. Willard looks over, beginning to think Lance is crazy, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just something I read in the Free Press.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They just missed a good set -- the chicken shits ! Lance looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come up near their boards and climb on -- smoke hangs over the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try it again, you little bastards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I m not afraid to surf this place. I'll surf this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns, glowering to his lackeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring that R.T., soldier. He grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Duke Six to Hell's Angels -- Goddamit, I want that treeline bombed -- yeah -- napalm -- gimme some napalm -- son of a bitch -- yeah, I'll take H.Z. or C.B.U.'s if you got any of them -- just bomb 'em into the Stone Age, boy. He throws the R.T. back to a soldier -- another SALVO WHISTLES over -- everyone drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch. As the SHELLS EXPLODES on the beach behind him, KIlgore raises his M-16 and EMPTIES it full automatic in the general direction of the trees. He mumbles a few un- intelligible swear words and jams a new clip into his rifle turning to Lance -- KILGORE (continuing) We'll have this place cleaned up and ready for us in a jiffy, boy. Don't you worry. He FIRES another clip as the JETS SCREAM overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - COPTERS A sky-crane without pod descends slowly toward us -- The P.B.R. hangs below it. The Chief, mr. Clean and Chef stand watching this sight alomg with other soldiers. A man guides the descending copter till the boat settles carefully in the shallows. The Chief and others leap aboard; unshackle the hoists
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: load on ammunition and fuel. The battle is still going on around them. They all look up as a wadge of PHANTOMS streak over low and peel off one by one to begin their bombing run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MONTAGE Phantoms RAKE the trees with 20 mm CANNONS -- FIRE five inch ROCKETS in salvo -- "Bull Pup" MISSILES -- drop H.E. (high explosives) and C.B.U's (Cluster Bomb Units) and finally an immense amount of NAPALM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. The Chief is at the helm --the engine starts; Clean and Chef work feverishly, ducking for cover every-so- often when an EXPLOSION hits nearby. The boat begins to back out of the shallows. The EXPLOSIONS of NAPALM are reflected on their faces; the ROAR of the FIRE drowns out almost everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget that extra drum -- it's too damn hot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear on starboard -- Where's Lance an' the Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw that Colonel's Huey on the point -- Two HELICOPTERS SCREAM over FIRING ROCKETS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just get outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KILGORE, WILLARD , LANCE, OTHERS Kilgore watches the waves with his field glasses -- smoke drifts over. Lance crouches below. Willard is up looking off in another direction. SHELLS SCREAM over, but even their noise is drowned out by the fierce SHRIEK of the PHANTOMS and the deafening BLAST of HIGH EXPLOSIVES. Willard stares at the tree line where it comes down to the river. The JETS are making a hell of the tree line; a hell of fire and bust- ling steam thet nothing could live in. Willard's glance goes further downriver through the black smoke and there merging in the river -- small and vulnerable, is his boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. There it is; the boat. Lance looks over --  a tremendous relief on his face. But still there remains the threat of Kilgore, standing stark against the sky. Willard silently motions Lance toward the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't kill us. (realizing as he says it) We're on his side. Kilgore FIRES another clip at the tree line, and then strides back without looking at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You smell that. (louder) You smell that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Napalm, boy -- nothing else in the world smells like that -- They reflect the glow from the burning trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the smell of napalm in the morning. One time we had a hill bombed for 12 hours. I walked up it when it was all over; we didn't find one of 'em ... not one stinking gook body. They slipped out in the night -- but the smell -- that gasoline smell
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the whole hill -- it smelled like ... (pause) victory... He looks off nostalgically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, some day this war's gonna end..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know. Suddenly he senses something -- he stops -- lifts his hand -- then frantically licks his fingers and puts them up in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind -- LANCE What? Sure enough there is a rushing breeze that increases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel it -- it's the wind -- it's blowing on shore -- It's on shore ! He leans down and practically grabs Lance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna blow this place out. It's gonna ruin it ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid can't ride sloppy waves. They turn and stare out to sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SURFERS The wind has changed. Instead of blowing spray back over the waves and hollowing them out, this strange wind is causing white caps and cross chop.. reducing the swell to slop. Mike and Johnny lay low on their boards, overjoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid can't stand sloppy waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LANCE, KILGORE, WILLARD WILLARD You don't expect this kid to ride that crap, do you? He's a goddamn artist, he needs something to work with... Slapping Lance on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm an artist, goddamit !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- yeah, I can understand how you feel. He turns toward the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the napalm -- it's causing the wind -- ruining my perfect left. He staggers off toward the trees followed by his guards and other lackeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The napalm -- ruin -- napalm my perfect left -- my perfect left point break -- napalm -- Lance motions with his eyes to Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. The P.B.R. along the river shallows -- The Chief and crew waiting and yelling.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: VIEW ON WILLARD AND LANCE WILLARD

direction.raw_text: . VIEW ON WILLARD AND LANCE WILLARD Are you finished surfing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to say goodbye to the Colonel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's get the hell out of here. They break and run like hell toward the boat in the distance. OUR VIEW TRACKS with them. They are cheered by the crew -- suddenly, Willard sees some- thing and stops... Lance continuing. In a pile of equipment that the Hueys have left are two surfboards
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willard looks at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- no, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one's the Colonel's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Yater -- the clear one with the thin stringer. Willard glances over to it with determination. There is still MORTAR FIRE coming in between him and the board. Suddenly, Willard makes a run for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incoming ! Incoming -- son of a bitch. The ROUNDS bracket the P.B.R. and line up the beach toward Willard. He stands there and doesn't move, the surfboard under his arm. The shells kick up sand. Lance has dropped. Fragments whistle by, one rips a chunk of foam and fibreglass from the rain of the board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one , Lance?
direction.name: direction
