direction.raw_text: Yeah, Jesus Christ ! Once again, Willard takes off fast as hell with the board under his arm. Lance follows toward the boat, through the water. Willard hands the board up to Mr. Clean, and they both scamper abroad, exhausted and relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was a kid I, never had a Yater spoon. Mr. Clean stuffs the board in the stern 50 Cal. mount. The boat turns -- ENGINES RUNNING HARD and ROARS OFF toward the deeper water of the river -- the board clearly visible on the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - P.B.R The P.B.R. ROARS BY going down the river at full speed. It is swerving and zig-zagging to avoid potential enemy fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all are in full battle positions -- their twin fifty Cal. guns turning; warily covering the jungled banks. The Chief is at helm -- Willard crouches against some armor plate, huddled with his M-16 ready. Chef is behind him at the radio. Lance leans back from his forward turret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we better stay in under the trees till dark -- we got his Yater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't look like he'd take that sitting down. They all look up into the sky -- expecting the worst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's put some distance between us and Charlie. The Chief nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance --- LANCE Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you roll us a big joint? I think the Captain'd like that. They all look at Willard uneasily. After a suspensful pause, Willard smiles:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take one a mine -- He fishes into his breast pocket -- pulls out a huge cigar-sized joint. They all smile -- Willard lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. It zig-zags away from us down the river at high speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boat is hidden under some trees along the river bank. The men wait tensely listening -- LANCE You hear it again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I don't think so. But it'll be back. They were circling. It'll be back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he'd of shot us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any time -- us -- Americans. Lance looks over at Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think he d of shot us on the beach but -- he'd of shot us if he saw me taking the board -- LANCE A Yater spoon is hard to get -- especially here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a man who knows what he wants -- he does know what he wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I go get those mangos now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go with you in a while -- judt hold tight awhile -- LANCE Captain -- that was all true about the rats and chocolate and stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you could just tell when the supplies were booby trapped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a feeling you get in the jungle. When you get good, you can find a track and tell not only how many they are, but their morale, how far they're going, whether they're near their camp, the weapons they're carrying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you tell their weapons.. an' how far they're going? Willard smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mostly from the imprints when they put them down to rest. their morale from the way they drag their feet, or the joints that may be lying around. If they're near a base camp, they wouldn't be conserving food; they'll be throwing it away half-eaten. If the branches aren't broken, their weapons are slung. But all this is just technique.. There's a feeling you get after a while, that's what's important. I was going through a village once. I was looking for a certain party. I took off my boots, and walked into each hut. It was midnight. I went into three like that and suddenly I realized I d gone into each hut the same way -- standing up -- so the next one I went in on my belly. An RPD burst took out the door a bit above my head. (he shrugs) Things like that. A pause, and then suddenly his attention is diverted -- They all are silent -- It is pitch dark -- we HEAR the distant SOUND of ROTOR-BLADES and indistinguishable language on a loudspeaker -- The talk stops -- the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grow LOUDER until almost overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not gonna hurt or harm you, boy -- I just want the board back -- You can understand -- It was one of my best -- You know how hard it is to get a board you like, boy. I'm not gonna hurt or harm you -- Just leave it where I can find it -- The HELICOPTER DRONES on into the night -- the same speech starts again further off -- Finally the noise ceases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus -- that guy's too damn much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if that was the same copter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's probably got 'em all over the river with that recording. We better move now while it's dark. Chef steps forward with a plastic basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Chef -- go ahead -- take Lance with you -- WILLARD I'll go with him -- They all look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanta get my feet on solid land once in awhile -- He grabs an M-16 and follows Chef over the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CHEF, WILLARD - NIGHT They cautiously walk through the underbrush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir -- WILLARD Why they call you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me what, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chef -- is that 'cause you like mangoes an' stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir -- I'm a real chef, sir
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a sauciere -- WILLARD A sauciere -- CHEF That's right, sir -- I come from New Orleans -- I was raised to be a sauciere.. a great sauciere. We specialize in sauces; my whole family. It's what we do. I was supposed to go to Paris and study at the Escoffier School; I was saving the money. They called me for my physical so I figured the Navy had better food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cook school -- that did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They lined us all up in front of a hundred yards of prime rib -- magnificent meat, beautifully marbled.. Then they started throwing it in these big cauldrons, all of it -- boiling. I looked in, an' it was turning gray. I couldn't stand it. I went into radio school. They move into a slight clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: quiet -- Chef crouches close -- redies his M-16. Willard ges- tures that he heard something; he points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: over jungle -- END REVEALING Willard and Chef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There... He points -- motions Chef to move away -- they cover the spot. A few yards from them they hear something move. It is obviously no small jungle creature. They walk toward a patch of black elephant grass; their guns at the ready. They look at each other. Willard is cold, methodical, doing something he knows well. There is a noise again -- some of the growth rustles.  He and Chef move a distance apart, and join in stalking the probable V.C. Willard directs the Chef with hand gestures, and bird and cricket sounds. They move stealthily, closing the apex of their triangle on the hunted. The two men drop low into the elephant grass, and remain motionless. Then Willard makes the cricket noise, and they move closer. Willard's left hand edges out along the M-16's far end, so that he only has to point the finger of that hand and he will hit what he wants. He makes another command and they rush the trapped enemy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD AND CHEF Suddenly there is a RUSHING SOUND -- The grass folds down quickly toward them -- willard plants his feet and from the hip lets go FULL AUTOMATIC. The Chef retreats
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: short BURSTS into the grass -- the grass folds almost to Willard -- then a huge tiger leaps out at them; snarling magnificently. They FIRE wildly, emptying their clips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a motherfucking tiger -- goddamn... He turns and bolts through the jungle, as scared as a man can be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn -- Jesus Christ tiger -- motherfucking tiger -- ohhhhhhhhh -- Willard jams another clip in his gun and backs out of the clearing, covering the bushes and runs, scared out of his head as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE CREW They all are armed -- Lance has the twin 50's pointed into the jungle. Chef comes screaming out of the brush, throws his rifle into the boat and dives headfirst after it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhhh -- tiger ! Oh goddamn ! It's a tiger ! Jesus Christ ! Goddamn, a tiger ! Ohhhhhhhh. The Chief tries to grab him; takes his gun away, but is unable to take a hold of the Chef, as he slithers around the boat, trying to find safety. willard follows from the jungle -- The Chef is moaning and stares off into the night.

Soldiers are everywhere -- scurrying from trenches, carrying materials for the bridge or tending to the wounded, the maimed and the dead. Light automatic WEAPON FIRE is HEARD occasionally. direction.raw_text: I think this river wants to take us home fast. I'm practically goin' in reverse. Willard points his pole in the direction of the mouth of a tributary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, get in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This whole area is lousy with V.C. -- We don't stand a chance. Lemme turn around and we'll be in Hau Fat in six minutes. There is a really loud WHACK against the hull. willard really mad, throws the pole at the Chief, who ducks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in there !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my crew and my fucking boat, and I'm the responsible party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in there now or I'll bury you in this river. It's clear that Willard will kill the Chief if he doesn't do as he says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fucking crazy. You're going to get us all killed. The P.B.R. navigates through the rush and into the mouth of the tributary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE TRIBUTARY - P.B.R. - RAIN Rain is pouring down, but the P.B.R. is slowed down to a snail's pace by Hyacinths, literally across the waterway. Willard, Chef and Clean in the water, cutting through them with machetes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: having climbed to the highest point of the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It breaks through in about twenty feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cutting through. he looks to Chef, who has stopped cut- ting, and is staring into the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He looks out -- the jungle at this point is very dark and high -- totally impenetrable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep cutting. They work feverishly, knowing something is wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cutting with all he's got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it sounds stupid, but I feel like the goddamn jungle's watching us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatdoya think it thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That we're dumber than we look. Chef stops again, looks hard, trying to penetrate the darkness and from the very depth of it -- the darkness of it, comes a stream of tracers, lazily arching out at them. It whips between them -- the SOUND FOLLOWING much later. Other BULLETS SMASH through and ricochet off the deck fittings. GLASS SHATTERS, and a huge hunk of paint is removed from the armor shield by a 20 mm cannon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance -- 'bout twenty meters starboard. Lance leaps down to his position. Willard, Clean and Chef cut feverishly, as the trapped boat struggles to get free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There in the trees ! Everything is confusion -- yelling -- GUNFIRE -- the THUD of heavy BULLETS ripping inti the P.B.R.'s fibreglass hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance's twin guns return the FIRE. The Chief moves to one of the heavy guns and joins Lance in returning the FIRE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushing, cutting. Bullets SMASH and EXPLODE around. Clean climbs onto the boat, and leaps onto a gun emplace- ment.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 141 VIEW ON THE MEN IN THE WATER

direction.raw_text: . VIEW Nobody really knows where the erratic fire is coming from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevate Lance, in the tree. No, I saw another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty meters up, Lance; I saw the fucking flash. Lance grits his teeth, FIRING -- 143  CLOSE SHOT ON CLEAN 144  POV BEHIND CLEAN He BLASTS short bursts of tracers into the jungle, cutting it to salad. Suddenly more tracers from another direction
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clean swings around -- BULLETS smash against his shield and rip chunks from the surfboard. He BLASTS a long heavy burst at the jungle -- trees crumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ripping 'em, man, son-of-a- bitch, it's jammed, oh God, it's jammed. Clean is riddled by MACHINE GUN FIRE. Chief runs to Mr. Clean -- it is obvious that he is dead. He looks angrily to Willard. Willard and Chef are practically through. Willard leaps up, as Chef finishes the last strokes. He moves toward the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw me that ordnance. Chef throws him an M-79 and several shells -- Willard opens it, jams a huge projectile and pulls himself over the edge of the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me some kind a field a fire -- BULLETS rip by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're through. He climbs aboard and collapses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God -- LANCE (FIRING) I ain't finished ! I ain't finished !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring that bow ordnance into those trees. He jams his gun up as he sees a flash and FIRES -- there is a low POP and a WHISTLE as the GRENADE arches into the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - BEHIND THEM He FIRES another burst as the GRENADE EXPLODES brightly. There is another POP and WHISTLE , another BLAST. A large tree falls, just as the craft speeds up through the thin- ning growth. We HEAR strange SCREAMING from the trees and jungle, hideous MOANS and terror-filled CRIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jams the throttle forward -- the boat surges ahead. Willard FIRES another GRENADE from his M-79.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. The boat slams through the hyacinth growth, moving through the river, FIRING BACK at unseen enemy in the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. - TWILIGHT The boat moves ahead at half speed through a wide, flat area in the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW The men sit around, exhausted, brutalized, wounded. They look like animals, but they are relaxed, be- cause they know they're too far from the banks to be shot at. They smoke pot and eat silently. Lance smokes a joint and looks at his gun. Splotches of paint have been blown away from the armor shield -- pieces of deck are ripped and ragged around the mount. The boat is a floating wreck. Clean's body is being prepared in a plastic sack by Chief. All of the men are silent. Chef comes up from below; he has been wounded in the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's some bad holes, man, and the cracks -- water's coming through the cracks. Food's shot to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Less than half -- sure is a mess down there. Chief has been silent by the body of Clean in a plastic sack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the grass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still got a lot of that stuff from Nha Trang. But we're running low on the other. Chief pushes Clean's body into the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He notices something in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW Willard stands up, pointing up the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. They all look over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a light down there -- CHEF Yeah, it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the middle of the jungle -- a goddamn light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. - THE TWILIGHT The P.B.R. approaches the distant light -- which seems to be on the dock of an overgrown plantation building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: straining to see; he uses field glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems to be some figures standing on the dock. The figures pull back behind some drums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch it ! They duck as SHOTS RING OUT from the dock, stitching the water across the P.B.R.'s bow. The crew crouches, guns trained on the dock as the boat still approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not Cong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're Americans. Another BURST, closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you shouldn't say we're Americans? Willard stares at the dock and building, trying to figure it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chef, try your French. Chief hands the loud-hailer to Chef, who shrugs and shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nous sommes Americains -- Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nous ne voulon pas vous agresser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks through the glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH THE GLASSES Gradually, a small group appears from behind the drums on the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: French Nationals -- they may not be too friendly, though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We drift closer to the dock. The Chef starts enjoying speaking French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nous sommes Americains -- nous sommes des amis -- There is silence as the boat drifts closer. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vous parlez Francais comme une vache espanole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was pretty good, myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said I speak French like a Spanish cow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laisser tomber vos armes -- CHEF Put the guns straight up -- stand away from the mounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it. They do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vous pouvez approcher mais doucement -- CHEF Take her in slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DOCK The men on the dock move forward, cautiously. They are a young man, PHILIPPE, about 25, strong and handsome, save for a scar down on the side of his face and through his left eye, which is covered by a patch. He is dressed in a tiger suit and the red beret of the French colonial para- troops. Also of the red beret are HENRY LeFEVRE, a bear- ded, dark-looking man of 35, and TRAN VAN KAC, a middle- aged half-breed slave. They all bear automatic weapons and suspicious in their eyes. As the boat pulls up to the dock, another Frenchman joins the group, obviously the head man, GASTON De MARAIS, about fifty, small and deli- cate, with a strength about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hands on the heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't steer with my goddamn feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, they speak American.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is the commanding officer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am -- I'm Captain B.L. Willard. This is Chief Warrant Officer Phillips -- it's his boat. We were shot up bad downriver and need repairs and food -- we can pay you in gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Philippe -- Philippe moves to another position -- Kac grabs the rope from the deck and ties it to the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll help you with -- PHILIPPE Do not move -- Gaston looks at the skyward pointed twin fifties admiringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty calibers, eh, Captain -- WILLARD As I said, we can pay you in gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Entirely unnecessary, Captain. He puts down his gun -- the others do likewise -- GASTON We share a common enemy -- you are our guests. (he steps back) I am Gaston de marais -- this is my family's plantation. It has been such for 121 years. It will be such after I die. This is my son, Philippe -- he has fought in Algeria and held the rank of Captain. And Henry LeFevre -- a sergeant; he was at Dien Bien Phu. My personal servant, Tran Van Kac --- Then he motions to the trees. A young man in a tiger suit and three women come forward from different positions -- all wear bush clothing and bear weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My youngest son -- Christian -- 161  CLOSE SHOT - CHRISTIAN He carries an M-60 machine gun in his hand -- a belt of ammunition trailing off behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christian's wife -- Ann-Marie -- A tall girl, goodlooking, but severe -- she carries an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my youngest daughter -- Claudine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an attractive girl about eighteen. She wears a red paratrooper beret and a well-fitted bush suit. She carries an M-79 grenade launcher and plenty of ammunition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - P.B.R. - CREW, GASTON, OTHERS They stand there, exhausted and amazed. Philippe yells in Vietnamese -- about a dozen native men in tiger suits, heavily armed, walk out of the trees from all around them. They look the Americans over warily and assemble at Philippe's command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: American weapons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We took them from the dead. (smiles) Now -- I assume you want to rest, to shower. We'll attend to your repairs after dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shower. Willard's men look at one another, dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't want to bother you any, we -- GASTON A man of war is never bothered to aid an ally -- you will follow me, Captain. Willard steps off -- then stops, reaches back and picks up his M-16 by the stock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A habit of men of war, sir -- you understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, Captain -- an unfortunate necessity. The men are relieved. They pick up their weapons and follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My men will keep it for you -- CHIEF Yeah -- well, I'll stay with the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chief. (pause) Come with us. They look at each other a moment. The Chief shrugs and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD, GASTON, OTHERS Gaston stops, points to a guest house off the main struc- ture which is a typical jungle plantation house, save the many sandbagged gun emplacements and barbed wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A suitable accomodation for your men, captain -- you will, of course, be quartered with us -- He indicates that the men should follow Philippe. The Chief is hesitant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead -- Philippe leads them on, muttering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, this way. Willard follows -- they walk over past the house and toward the jungle, approaching a huge crater, 100 feet across and about thirty feet deep. The bottom is filled with water and young French and Vietnamese children swim in it. On the opposite rim, sit two men and a woman with machine guns. Gaston strides up and looks down at the crater with pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magnificent, eh, Captain? Willard looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is very good -- there is no current -- It is very good. I have never seen one like it in all Indochina. I was in Paris when it arrived -- do you know what might have caused -- WILLARD Looks like a two thousand pound to me. Yeah, a two thousand pound bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I've seen those in Normandy. This is much better. (pause) My country -- my country could never originate this. Magnificent. Gaston stands in serious admiration for this feat; Willard looks between him and this big hole in the ground in amezement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WORKMEN'S SHOWER - EVENING A foreman's shower from the old plantation days. The Chief steps out of it, refreshed, though still exhausted. Lance stands there, about to step in, absolutely filthy, caked with blood. His reaction is odd; rather than just stepping into the shower, he seems almost frightened, reluctant to step in. Chef is waiting behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hot shower, hot damn. He pushes him forward into the water. The dirt and caked mud go swirling off his face and shoulders, and he relaxes as though he suddenly remenbers what a shower is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE DOCK - P.B.R. - EVENING battered and torn -- a few of Philippe's Vietnamese guard at the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WILLARD'S QUARTERS - EVENING A beautiful European room with tall ceilings. Still elegantly furnished, although old and decaying. Willard sits in a comfortable chair in the corner of the room, looking out over the carpet,  the bed with its elegant spread; the wash basin; the bidet. His battle dress is black with muck, with bloodstaines and burns. He rises from the chair and steps to a dresser above which is a large mirror. There is an album on the marble top of the dresser. He turns to a page at random.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: haggard, looking down at the album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wondered -- how long has this room been like this; how long has the furniture been standing in these places?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some old photographs of people standing around a car in the 20's in front of the plantation. Another picture shows a child playing by the rubber trees near the plantation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it like this sixty years ago? Eighty years? But here, even eighty years is nothing. He turns the page, The plantation being built. Pictures of the framing, skeletal against the sky and jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fascinated
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was jungle, once; and it will be jungle, again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onlu the very beginnings of the house; the first struc- tures. Then another picture of the jungle site where it was to be built.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW ON WILLARD He looks up and sees his own face, reflected in the garish mirror. He barely recognizes himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW Willard looks at himself in the mirror, in this odd, out- of-time room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DINING ROOM GROUP - TRACKING SHOT TRACK DOWN the long table, covered with delicious food. The P.B.R. crew sits with others of the De Marais group. The table is headed by St. LeFevre. Chef's face lights up as he regards the wonderful European-style food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This food is wonderful ! I can't believe the chef is a slope. (turning to Clean) Some more? Opposite the table, sitting next to the Chief, Lance reaches hungrily for bread and other food with his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- Lance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Oh. Um, wouldya .. wouldya pass me the Rice-a-roni, please. And then he looks to his friends for approval. Our VIEW REVEALS that behind a transparent silk curtain there is another, more elaborate table, where the De Marais family is dining with Willard. Our VIEW MOVES through the curtain and settles in a MEDIUM VIEW of the group. The men rise as a very attractive woman enters the room. Willard finally does as well, and she moves to the chair next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne, I hope you are feeling better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Je vais bien maintenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I present Captain Willard? He is of a paratroop regiment. You know the difference between a paratrooper and a regular soldier, don't you , my dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, they come from the sky. She sits -- there's an uneasy silence. Willard is caught with this exotic woman on one side of him, and the ongoing conversation on the other. He is forced to face toward Gaston, and drawn to look at Roxanne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to know more about the .. uh, plaque... Philippe turns around, points to an elaborately scripted wooden plaque with various tallies on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attacks repulsed, as I was saying. (hard) This is only  for this war, Captain. Viet Cong -- 54; North Vietnamese regular forces -- 15; South Vietnamese -- 28 -- regular forces and otherwise. (pause) Americain -- 6. Of course, they were, perhaps, mistakes, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. I -- Once we make our repairs, we could send word, we could have you evacuated from here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get blown outta here some day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will never 'evacuate', Captain
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this is our home. Indochina is ours; it has been so for a hundred and twenty-one years, there is something to say for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Vietnamese think it's theirs
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess the Americans do, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we civilized it. A place belongs to those who bring light to it, don't you agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always thought the French came here to get the rubber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, I must attend to my men. He gets up, and leaves abruptely -- followed by his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I ask where the Captain is going in his little boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were going upriver when we got caught in a storm, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upriver? Why upriver? There is nothing there, only jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know that jungle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was a boy, my father would take me there, to hunt. There are a few savages, but no man can live there, no white man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about an American named Kurtz? There is a pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have never heard of him. Gaston rises, and takes Roxanne's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bon nuit, Roxanne -- bon nuit, Captain. Willard turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Gaston leaves. Willard and Roxanne are left alone. The servants clear the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must realize, Captain -- we have lost much here -- I, my husband. Gaston -- his wife and son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to hear that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cognac?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be checking on the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war will still be here tomorrow. She walks out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess so. He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SITTING ROOM - FULL SHOT - WILLARD AND ROXANNE Roxanne sits, pouring a brandy, while Willard stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you miss your home, Captain? Have you someone there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not really. I was discharged from the army four years ago. I went home, wasted some time, bought a Mustang Mach 1, drove it a week. Then I re-upped for another tour. No, everything I love is here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you are like us. She reaches out to him; indicating that he sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do after the war?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just follow my footsteps, one at a time, trying to answer the little questions and staying away from the big ones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's a big question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kurtz. (pause) I know you've heard of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That strange things.. terrible things have occured around this American, Kurtz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gaston would never tell me. It was asubject not to be spoken of, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know -- deeper in the jungle, upriver -- there are savages?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Captain, I mean -- cannibals. A long pause. Then she looks at the cognac she poured for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a pity, you don't drink. Since my husband died, there are so many things I must do alone. She takes a sip. Willard moves to the French doors, which have been left partly open to let a breeze in. He steps onto a terrace overlooking the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE TERRACE - MED. VIEW - WILLARD - NIGHT A machine gun emplacement is situated on the terrace cover- ing the front of house, from the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you warm, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The river is beautiful. In fact, we REALIZE that he is checking the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The P.B.R. is under guard by a couple of Gaston's Vietnamese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW ON WILLARD, ROXANNE She, thinking it romantic to talk about the river, comes up behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spend hours watching that river from my bedroom window. It fascinates me. She moves her body close to his; and, in a moment, he is kissing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One eye steals another look at the P.B.R.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. Two of the guards leave -- two remain, getting ready for the long night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ON THE TERRACE His hands wander over her body as she clings to him. Then she takes his hand, and leads him back into the sitting room, and up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROXANNE'S ROOM - FULL VIEW It is dark. She leads him into her room and closes the door. He stands there. In the center of the room is a large canopied bed with mosquito netting hanging down over it. The windows also have netting and barbed wire -- there is a .30 calibre machine gun mount in the far one. He look around. she goes over to the bed, and turns down the sheets. Then she slips out of her dress and stands there facing him. He puts down his gun and strips off his shirt. She lays down on the bed and watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have been lonely here, Captain. He moves to her, slipping into the bed. M-16 is leaning against the wall in his reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROXANNE'S TERRACE - NIGHT We can VIEW into the room, as Willard has silently slipped out of her bed, and is a dark sinister figure kneeling in final preparations for going out in the night. Without a sound, he comes out to the terrace, and scales down the wall of the old building, disappearing into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE DOCK - P.B.R. - NIGHT Two Vietnamese guard the P.B.R. -- suddenly, feet first, the first disappears into the thicket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW ON WILLARD in the thicket; we realize he has just killed the man with a knife. Willard stalks the second guard and makes quick work of him with his knife. He even enjoys it. Silently, he drags the body out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW ON THE P.B.R. The dark figure boards the boat silently. He disappears into the hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lifts out several cases of supplies, working quickly, with a grace that indicates he is a man who has done his best work alone, and at night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROXANNE'S ROOM - CLOSE SHOT - WILLARD - MORNING He sleeps soundly alone in the bed - we HEAR SOMEONE moving around in the room. He wakes suddenly -- PULL BACK TO REVEAL Roxanne combing her hair and buttoning up her blouse. She notices he is awake and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will fix you breakfast. He starts to get up.
direction.name: direction

There is no undergrowth, just the tall trees and ferms. They move ahead at half speed, alert, ready for anything.

direction.raw_text: We moved deeper and deeper into the jungle. It was very quiet there. It was like wandering on a prehistoric planet, an unknown world ... where the men thought they crawled to, I don't know. For me, we crawled toward Kurtz -- exclusively. Willard looks out ahead and points. They all turn their guns in that direction. We PAN TO REVEAL a small village of huts along the bank.

direction.raw_text: - VILLAGE 194  POV. OF THE P.B.R. They pass in front of the village which is rundown and completely deserted. The huts are on stilts to avoid the flooding of the river -- they are just skeletons of what they once were.

direction.raw_text: BOAT - FULL SHOT - JUNGLE The canopy of trees grows taller and stretches out across the river filtering the sun. The forest itself has grown darker and more twisted with ferns and creepers. Strange birds fly out of the trees as the boat passes -- a huge snake slips along an overheading limb. The depth of the jungle is dark, ominous -- yet cool and strangely inviting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - JUNGLE Suddenly the river widens, the trees give way to marsh and as they emerge into the light a strange shadow falls upon the boat. It is the shadow cast by an enormous vertical tail section of a B-52 bomber thrusting out from the mud. Pieces of aluminum hang loosely from it, oxi- dizing in the sun. Creepers have already started to grow up around its heights -- the jungle is claiming it. But once under its shadow, they have passed a gateway. A gateway to paradise. The river widens and the trees at its edge are soft and seductive. The hills beyond are purple and lush. Strange orange colored water-fowl swim lazily out of their way. The water itself is glass smooth and black as if there were no bottom. The sun is warm and the breeze gentle and laced with wild gardenians. It is indeed the most peaceful valley in all the world and each man looks upon it and has never known such a sense of peace and well- being. Each man in his heart feels a need to stay -- his soul cries to stop -- stop their madness -- this spiral into hell. Here is all that can be had of earth. But no hand moves. The boat drifts on its own toward a hole at the end of the clearing. A hole into the jungle from which a darkness permeats. The boat follows the river into this hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - P.B.R. - RIVER - DAWN The skull looms in the f.g. -- the P.B.R. is pulled back about seventy yards -- Early morning mist still hangs on the water -- as it clears, we SEE another post and skulls on the opposite bank, It is strangely quiet.

Everything was still, the trees, the creepers, even the brush seemed like it had been changed into some kind of stone. It was unnatural, like a trance. Not a sound could be heard. I began to think I was deaf -- then the fog came suddenly, and I was blind too. The boat disappears in the thick fog.

direction.raw_text: Here they are in Los Angeles. Everything is safe. There's a supermarket around the corner, the police station around the other. It would seem ridiculous to them that I was shot to hell because I had lost the privilege of listening to the mysterious Colonel Kurtz. (pause) Of course I was wrong. He was waiting for me. Kurtz was alive and he was waiting for me.

direction.raw_text: Hundreds and hundreds of Montagnard natives -- dressed in the most ornate and primitive manner: feathers, parts of birds and animals; cod-pieces -- all in body and face paint of the most savage nature. But there is a purity about them, men and boys, standing passively watching the small Navy craft flying the strange flag of red, white and blue.

direction.raw_text: .B.R. The men of the crew are not the same men who began this voyage. Their manner is lifeless as though in a trance. The various decorations and paraphenelia that they have picked up along the way seem oddly relevant to the savages that stand before them. The Chef has made a hat of birdfeathers; Lance's face has been painted with mud under the eyes to block the glare of the sun. He wears certain animal skins; trinkets; some animal teeth. Their uniforms have been torn and patched throughout the difficult journey. They start to move to their gun positions.

The natives standing across the river make no hostile gestures as they approach. They accept the small boat moving toward them with a sort of inevi- tability. The boat moves closer, approaches the wall of feathers -- which slowly and automatically gives away, in almost a ritual of birth, undulating, allowing the little boat to penetrate.

A thick greasy smoke hangs from fires that burn near the fort; fresh shell craters indicate a recent battle. Near the dock there is a tangled clump of corpses -- half sub- merged in the water. direction.raw_text: VIEW - WILLARD, MOONBY AND THE CREW As they proceed closer to the fortress-temple, men appear where a moment before there was only jungle. They are mostly Montagnards, but far more savage looking than any we've seen before. They wear only loinclothes and bandoliers of ammunition. their bodies are painted in strange patterns. They carry Army M-16's, Russian AK-47's and a wide variety of knives and clubs. Women emerge from the brush as well. they are armed and equally primitive looking. Interspersed among them are a few taller men with paler skins, with the remnants of Army insignia on them. The paint on their bodies is, if anything more bizarre. We CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS the entire group up to the stone gates of the fort, where thirty or so more are seen silhouetted against the sky. Willard and his men look up at people more primitive and more savage than any since the time of Captain Cook. They encounter, in the center of the group, what once appears to have been an American. he is tall, gaunt, wears a flak jacket, but is otherwise naked, save a loincloth. His face is darkened from dirt, battle smoke, strange camouflage patterns. His hair and beard are long, matted with mud and grease. He carries an AK-47 decorated with scalps and human ears. Willard approaches this beast, who seems shy and retiring.

He slowly attempts to pull the remnants of his uniform together, though it is ripped and bloodied, and now combined with primitive ornaments designating him a tribal chief, as well as his U.S.A. Colonel's insignia. He is feverish, with long blonde hair and beautiful features. His eyes almost hypnotize. His midsection is bandaged from what seems to be a serious wound.

direction.raw_text: Do you know me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Kurtz reaches down; takes the .45 -- and without another word or gesture, shoots and kills a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know me ? He throws the .45 back on the dirt. Rises, and walks back into the cavernous headquarters behind the shrunken heads. Moonby scampers off after him, a respectful distance behind. Even Willard is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KURTZ'S OUTPOST - FULL VIEW - TWILIGHT Dotted with campfires; Montagnard families -- it is like a primitive civilization.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willard is alone by a campfire -- his M-16 leans by a wall next to him. He is exhausted. Lance sleeps by the fire, a little distance away. Chef approaches, crouches down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain -- they've been probed all this week -- Cong and NVA regulars. There's gonna be a big offense any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Lance stirs; starts to wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kurtz. I'm supposed to kill him, just like he said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I can see that. He's fuckin nuts -- WILLARD Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed that guy without feeling anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you kill Cong, don't you feel something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. (thinking) Recoil... I feel the recoil of my rifle. Willard rises. Chef looks at him, confused and frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD, CHEF , LANCE Willard walks along the top of a thick wall -- sandbagged and dug out every so often for an M-60 or a mortar emplacement. Wild looking savages man these guns, and seem to bow to Willard as he passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is good -- triple overlapping fields of fire -- walls so thick ordinary artillery just cleans the moss off their surfaces. A woman tentatively moves to Willard, bowing, and then runs off to her bunker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with them as they move past the groups of people, huddled by their fires... men, women and children. Skulls, shrunken and otherwise hang from every hut -- adorn every sandbagged bunker -- dried scalps hang from barbed wire. A child is chewing on a big piece of almost raw meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've done things, when I was alone in the jungle -- that I never told anyone about. They continue past amount where the shattered wreck of half a helicopter is laying. It has been altered and fortified with sandbags and concertina wire. The wreck lays on its side so that a 7.62 mini-gun that was mounted there sticks up above the sandbags. The emplacement is built on amound so the gun commands a clear field of fire into the jungle beyond. Some Americans, barely recognizible because of their beards and savage manner, sit near the gun. Several Montagnard children giggle at their feet and play with bayonets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is evil -- evil, Captain. We're all gonna die here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it -- You said your mission was to kill him. Let's do it, an' get our asses outta here. This  Kurtz is ruining the war; I mean, this don't look good for America !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... he's an amazing officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to kill this sonuvabitch
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance and me, we don' t understand none of this -- Jesus, Captain -- I don't wanna die here
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it quick. Lance just stands there; his eyes vacant.. He sort of nods, sucking a joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I know. He thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KURTZ HEADQUARTERS - NIGHT VIEW FROM INSIDE -- Willard approaches the stakes with the shrunken heads. Chef and Lance with him. Willard steps in -- Lance and the Chef crouch outside, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An austere stone savern in the temple: Kurtz's head- quarters. Electric lights hanging in odd contrast to the ancient stone. We SEE what is left of the maps and other military charts -- they had been tacked up on big boards, but have now fallen into decayed disuse. There are other indications of the modern headquarters this had been. Now all those things are no longer impor- tant.  Kurtz sits alone, slumped back in a wicker chair. There is a large wooden planning table next to him, with maps, lamps and apile of debris that is practically garbage. There are native decorations to ward off evil spirits; and graffiti on the stone walls, things ranging fromm "Viet Nam, love it or leave it" to quotes of Nietzsche "Nothing is true -- everything is permitted." Moonby, who had been crouching in a corner, moves to Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's asleep -- don't bother him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm awake. Willard steps in closer. Kurtz looks to Moonby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. Get out. Moonby hesitates -- not wanting to leave him alone with Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to kill the little weirdo myself tomorrow. (he shows some pain when moving his midsection) He s only stayed alive this long because he's a good orderly and medic. He knows how to use a hypodermic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna get hit tonight, bad -- a whole regiment of NVA regulars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, the little gook- pricks. But they are noble little gook-pricks, noble. Because they fight with their guts, like animals. And for an idea ! That's rich. We fight with ingenious machines and fire, like Gods, and for nothing. But I'll call in a major blotto airstrike tonight. We'll have ourselves a helluva airstrike tonight, a lightshow. How do you like The Doors': 'C'mon Baby Light My Fire...' Willard shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I like it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love it. He rests back, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gone crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. My thinking is clear. (calmly) But my soul has gone mad. Suddenly Kurtz is seized with a terrible pain from his stomach wound. He groans horribly, clutching at it. He literally falls from his chair onto the dirt floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My gut -- Oh, Christ, my gut ! Willard leans over him; checking the seriousness of the wound.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; suddenly) I said get the fuck out ! (to himself)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE HEADQUARTERS - NIGHT Lance is crouching by the stone entrance -- Chef leans in, witnessing the proceedings inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him -- come on, why don't you kill him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HEADQUARTERS - MED, VIEW - KURTZ AND WILLARD - NIGHT Willard examining the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit -- on the table; morphine. Willard moves to the table, opens the medical packet. He takes out a morphine capsule, leans over the writhing Kurtz and injects him with the drug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see how stupid it would have been to blow out my brains? I'm dying from the gut anyway. Willard quickly prepares another shot. Kurtz, truly frightened, holds up his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I don't want to sleep. I want to think. Water. Give me water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't have water after morphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still playing by the rules. (almost affectionately) You're a damn good kiler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the pain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can handle it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pain is easy to handle -- but nobility.. the nobility of a man is judged by how much Truth he can handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truth that you were sent here to murder me, ans so far you haven't done it. And do you know why? (looks at him) Yes, you know why. (he looks) Your mission makes about as much sense as those idiots who sent you on it. Asshole ! Schmuck ! How long does it take you to figure out that nobody knows what they're doing here. (coldly) Except me. He rests back. The drug is beginning to take effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what you're doing? You are interfering with my plans ! He crawls in pain toward the canteen Willard watches him impassively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This water's got Moonby's acid in it -- He drinks sloppily from the canteen, water spilling all over. Then he throws the canteen to Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink it -- drink it for tonight. Think of it. A whole regiment of those shitty little Cong -- War. Total war -- war like you've never known it. It's beautiful
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you'll love it. Trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HEADQUARTERS - MED. VIEW - LANCE AND CHEF - NIGHT We can SEE into the headquarters: Kurtz offers the canteen to Willard. Chef is terrified -- Lance is stoned out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lance -- the fucker's not gonna do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn -- You've gotta dig napalm on Speed, too. It's spectacular, you'll see. Lance stands up holding his M-16, looks into the cavern with Chef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEADQUARTERS - NIGHT Willard stands there, holding the morphine needle in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look into the jungle. You can't -- it's too terrible. You have to smear yourself with warpaint to look at it -- you have to be a cannibal. (whispered) That's why warpaint was invented. Then it becomes your jungle. Willard shoots himself in the arm with the morphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did we get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because of all the things we do, the thing we do best -- is lie .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think think a lie stinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Captain, that is so true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stinks. I could never figure -- (he drinks from the canteen) I could never figure how they can teach boys how to bomb villages with napalm -- and not let them write the word 'fuck' on their airplanes. Willard drinks more of the LSD water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could never figure it because it doesn't make sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what makes sense ! Air strikes ! White Phosphorus ! Napalm ! We'll bomb the shit out of them if they don't do what we want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll exterminate the fuckers ! Chef steps into the Headquarters -- he is terrified. He draws his bayonet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain -- kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think of it -- for years, millions of years, savages with pathetic painted faces were scared shitless that fire would rain down from the sky. And goddamn, we made it happen. God bless Dow !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him ! Chef rushes at Kurtz with his bayonet -- instinctively, Willard GUNS him -- then there is additional automatic
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Chef is being riddled by bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has let loose with his M-16 at Chef, like some sort of mindless, programmed killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hot damn ! Then hes tops -- Chef falls to the dirt -- there is an instant of silence, then:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OF THE TEMPLE AT NU MUNG BA

direction.raw_text: . OF THE TEMPLE AT NU MUNG BA - NIGHT The DOORS begin LIGHT MY FIRE , loud and overwhelming, as illuminating flares light up the blackness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE VIEW of enormous loudspeakers protected behind spirals of razor-sharp concertina wire. LIGHT MY FIRE is blasted out to the enemy, poised to attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cannibal-painted men in savage decorations wait. Bay- onets are fixed. Men are stoned to acid, injecting speed, sniffing cocaine, eating grass, smoking hashish in water pipes. One looks up to the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rocket illuminates the sky, strobing, as in a psyche- delic hallucination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow... Another behind him is chanting the word NAPALM softly t himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW ON THE GATE Willard strides out of the darkness, into the positions around the gate. He looks like a magnificent warrior -- Genghis. All the men: Montagnards, fierce Americans, even the savage men of the P.B.R. crew either bow, salute or kneel before Willard. The color pulsates around the edge of the image, red and green, mauve and purple. We SEE Lance; waiting, with his weapons -- garlands of teeth around his neck, his face painted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MONTAGE Enemy ARTILLERY BLASTING away at the fortress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand drops a shell and it FIRES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It FIRES. EXPLOSIONS around the fort, red and orange and blue and green. They hit and grow, outward like some sort of cosmic flower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoots out a stream of burning napalm that looks like a death ray gun, radiating outward with ice-blue energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blasting out music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE VIEW ON YOUNG SOLDIERS With the MUSIC, like those people you see listening to radios in their cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WILLARD , KURTZ , OTHERS (In SLOW MOTION) Shells WHISTLE in and EXPLODE on the walls in the compound. The men behind them are setting up rocket launcher (missile) . Everywhere metal and rock and flame fly and it is beautiful to see. Willard looks through the infra-red sniper scope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INFRA-RED POV Strange, luminescent images of North Vietnamese approach- ing the outer perimeters. Thousands of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mini-gun. Colby. Sergeant. Mini-gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in feathered head-piece and wildly painted operates the mini-gun with several native helpers. SHELLS BURST  around them. When they FIRE the SOUND is incredibly loud and steady like a high-pitched foghorn. A solid stream of molten lead seems to pour into the darkness as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rounds a minute rip into the enemy. The pass of the lead reaches out in beautiful patterns as the Ser- geant sweeps the area. The sergeant laughs maniacally as the GUN resumes FIRING, right up to the moment he is blown to eternity by an all-engulfing 105mm shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exhilarated, and moving with the MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Napalm. Colby pushes a row of plungers: Advancing NVAs il- luminated by napalm drums, phosphorescent napalm EXPLODES beautiful, like a magnificent firework.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claymores, claymores. The SOUND DISTORTED of tremendous HOWLING EXPLOSIONS penetrate the track of LIGHT MY FIRE one after another. Kurtz's face is illuminated by each of these. His face seems to change from one grotesgue primitive face to another, as though the whole history mankind is evolv- ing in front of us. The SCREAMS of maimed and dismembered men almost pene- trates the INCREDIBLY LOUD MUSIC and we HEAR Kurtz's men
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SCREAMING in delight. Kurtz looks out over the field of slaughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through wires and claymore glass, each wilder and more extreme. They burn in the pools of luminescent napalm but press relentlessly on. SHELL BURSTS overhead. They chant to themselves as they advance. NVA have reached the walls and throw down scaling ladders and start up. Suddenly the sky is bright with flares which produce weird psychedelic light. Blared out at tremendous vol- ume over and above the DIN OF BATTLE is LIGHT MY FIRE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - EVERYBODY The Americans and Montagnards stand up screaming. Spurred by MUSIC, they charge up. M-16's in both hands, blasting, kicking, bayoneting, gouging, splittin throats, biting necks, both sides collide in the utter and most horrible savagery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing on the wall BLASTING as bodies fall around him; he thrusts his bayonet into one attacker, removes it with a foot and stabs another. From him he takes his AK47 and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: more as they come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The VC rush his position. Willard trips a claymore that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: most of them to shreads. More fill in. Lance opens up FULL AUTOMATIC . Willard and Lance move down to the nest wall, FIRING , bodies tumbling over. Lance is caught in a CROSSFIRE and hit several times. He pulls himself up -- FIRES a final BURST and then falls under the enemy's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees this and scampers off into the jungle, muttering madly to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEW - WILLARD AT THE R.T. shouting into the radio
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Code -- Street Gang -- Street Gang ! Purgative air strike; Street Gang ! He turns and runs back through the compound with the receding Montagnards. SHELLS are EXPLODING everywhere. The light patterns are fantastic. Men fall, Viets break over the walls and charge. They crouch and rip into them FULL AUTOMATIC. They break the charge and continue cutting their way through the NVA masses like torches through metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KURTZ Kurtz watches as invaders swarm through his domain. Women and children rush upon him now. Kurtz flicks some switch- es and the whole north wall EXPLODES in overwhelming FIRE. The gates are uprooted. The stone lions tumble, crushing men below. Kurtz cocks an M-16 and walks off the bunker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching this spectacle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KURTZ He rounds  the shadow wall. Kurtz sees a group of Viets and rushes up and prepares a machine gun mount. They don't see him. He braces the gun at his side and steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles ! They stagger and fall, shattered and bleeding, save one who's merely lost his weapon. Kurtz looks at him, his gun empty. He drops it and flips open the flap of his holster. The Viet soldier goes for his pistol. Kurtz beats him to the draw and bloes him into the night. He moves over to pick up the NVA light machine gun. Holding it at his hip, he stands atop one of the ruined walls and FIRES into the masses. His native men see him and rush for the chance to die beside him. They are quickly encircled by onrushing Viets and are being overrun. The machine gun jams and Kurtz grabs a rifle. When it's empty and the bayonet is off he wields it as a club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KURTZ taking swings with his rifle, standing atop the wall and battering the oncoming enemy like Davy Crockett at the Alamo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE FORTRESS The air strike hits with all its force. Balls and rain of fire sweeps down on the temple, the enemy, everything. It is the biggest firework show in history. The wall Kurtz was standing on, and he falls with it. Willard sees this and makes his way toward him as the air strike continues. All around us is a spectacle of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and light and fire and overwhelming color.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: following Kurtz's trail in the mud. He has crawled on all fours back into the jungle to die. He stalks Kurtz into the jungle ; moving around and cutting off the crawling Kurtz
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away -- hide yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going back  - to the jungle to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking you back. You can still live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had immense plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna get you out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was on threshold of great things. Willard slings Kurtz's bleeding body around his neck, holding his hand, dragging hom through the jungle. The spectacle continues in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE P.B.R. - THE RIVER This wreck of a boat is still afloat. Willard crawls out of the jungle, carrying the dying Kurtz and manages to get him onto the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spectacle of total psychedelic war: the fortress of Nu Mung Ba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE TEMPLE - MORNING The entire temple is devastation. Vultures by the hundreds circle overhead. There are a few survivors. Everywhere is smoke and heaps of bodies. Colby, a Sergeant, and some Montagnards sit near them. Their eyes are red and glazed, their jaws hang slack and they tumble occasionally. They stagger away from the field of slaughter. Willard looks down and sees something. Moves over to it, kicks several bodies away and in the f.g. below is Lance, dead. Colby stumbles over. Willard holds Lance up by his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was the tragedy -- the tragedy of this war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .B.R. battered, moving slowly down the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colby is at helm. Kurtz lies feverish, delirious. Willard sits by him. As the boat moves, Montagnards, those left alive, come and pay their respects by the riverbanks. Colby takes an automatic weapon and FIRES it into the air. Some of the natives move in terror, frightened of him. The battle is not over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. Don't frighten them away. Willard looks down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you understand this? Kurtz looks up at him, past him with fury, longing in his eyes. There is a slight smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER - MED. VIEW The boat moves as though naturally carried by the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My river... my people... my jungle... my ideas... my country... my wife... (he looks at Willard) ... my death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had immense plans... immense plans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking you back. Kurtz looks up to him, then an expression of overwhelming intense and hopeless terror, hopeless despair. A whisper at some image, at some vision, he cries out twice, a cry that is no more than a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horror, the horror. We HEAR the distant SOUND of HELICOPTERS approaching. The SOUND of ROTORS in the distance. They look up, craning their eyes at the sky. Colby points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. Over the jungle mountains the small formation of MEDEVAC helicopters hooping toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did they know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must have seen the fire. The helicopters are closer now but high up. Two of them breaking off, spiraling in TOWARD US.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're coming to rescue us. They're Medevac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're coming to take us back. Copters directly overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel Kurtz, he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. He raises his M-16 and FIRES the entire clip at the ap- proaching rescue helicopter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It frantically pours on the power and wheels up to the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Colby takes his rifle and joins Willard in FIRING at the retreating American helicopters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men in the boat FIRING AT US as we fly further into the air, the boat getting smaller and smaller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Don't remember a lot about my rehabilitation... but I was sent back to the world before the fall of Saigon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARINA DEL RAY - EXTREME HIGH ANGLE - NIGHT MOVING DOWN back to the pleasure boat at the Marina. Pause. Willard is very silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never answered questions about Kurtz -- I gave them a few of his unimportant papers -- but for the most part I saved everything. There were other letters, personal ones written earlier to his wife. I brought them to het. I watched the fall of Saigon on television in a bar in Alameda...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CALIFORNIA NEIGHBORHOOD - DAY A bright clear day in a scrubbed-clean California neigh- borhood. Some kids are playing in the street. Willard, years later, dressed as a civilian, proceeds past the lawn to the attractive home, carrying a packet under his arm. He passes a lanky, young teen-aged boy working on a motor-scooter. Willard looks at him. The boy looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Then the door opens, and KURTZ'S WIFE is standing at the door. She is still beautiful, blonde, and dressed in mourning even though she doesn't wear black. There is a sense of purity about her, though she is not young.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in, Captain Willard. He enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KURTZ'S HOME - DAY Everything good and secure and desirable about America. She stands in the center of the room, a little nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get anything for you? There are pictures of Kurtz, not too many... but he is there in the various stages of his career. Then she sits suddenly, and Willard sits by her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know him very well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get to know each other pretty well out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you admired him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a remarkable man. It was impossible not to -- KURTZ'S WIFE Love him... Yes, it is true. That's the hard part for me... I knew him better than anyone ... I knew him best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew him best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were his friend... You must have been, if he had given you this... (the packet) If he sent you to his home. He was the best this country had -- he was -- WILLARD Yes, I know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never get over it -- But I'll always remember him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men looked up to him... (she loses herself in a thought) He died as he lived...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His death was -- yes, he died as he lived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you with him, when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I was... He said his last words to me. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT ON WILLARD A little of the madness is still with him. He knows what she will ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT ON KURTZ'S WIFE KURTZ'S WIFE Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE ON WILLARD remembering that incredible day moving down the river. Our VIEW LOOSENS KURTZ'S WIFE Tell me what he said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horror ! The horror !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spoke of you, ma'am. He sits there looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TIGHT HIGH ANGLE ON THE MARINA DEL REY BOAT The cocktail party is breaking up. Willard is one of the few guests left. We MOVE FROM Willard standing alone on the deck of the boat. Moving back through the departing guests. Charlie is getting ready to leave himself. We MOVE CLOSER to Willard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE RIVER - P.B.R. - DAY the boat floating down the river. Kurtz's body; an exhaust- ed, half-dead Colby. And HOLDING Kurtz, Willard. We HEAR THE DOORS' "THE END" as we present the END TITLES.
